site_status.message: This site is still baking in the web oven, please check back soon for the finished masterpiece!

works.title: Editorial Projects
works.summary: Here you'll find a selection of projects from various platforms and topics, highlighting skills in graphic design and editorial layouts

content.beforeParagraph: This series features three full spreads created for Destinations Magazine; showcasing the exotic charm of different tourist spots in India. Aiming for an elegant, modern look, the design is inspired by the vibrant scenery and architecture captured in stunning photography.

The magazine cover for a snowboarding publication features an energetic, urban design that reflects street culture. Combining bold graphics and bright colors, it merges the gritty aesthetics of city life with the excitement of snowboarding.

works.title: Honeysuckle Spread
works.summary: An editorial spread for HoneySuckle Magazine, a cannabis publication, reflecting modern style and focus on cannabis culture

content.beforeParagraph: The editorial spread for Volume XIV of HoneySuckle spotlights former professional football player Chris Ball and his family as they forge a legacy in the cannabis industry. The design employs classic black and white imagery, while bold, vibrant typography adds a dynamic touch.

works.title: Double Scorpio Anniversary
works.summary: This Instagram series celebrates Double Scorpio's 7-year milestone, inspired by the nostalgic charm of 80s VHS media with a hint of Y2K flair

content.beforeParagraph: The design merges retro 80s aesthetics with modern elements, featuring playful distortions of Double Scorpio's logos and branding. Combining contemporary typography with vintage-inspired graphics, it creates a visually striking and memorable experience.

The second design series continues the 80s VHS inspiration but with a colorful twist. A more vibrant palette enhances the nostalgic charm with bold hues, maintaining playful distortions and modern typography for a fun and playful visual experience.

works.title: Double Scorpio Work Compilation
works.summary: This project showcases design work for Double Scorpio, including a party flyer, social media graphics, holiday invitation, and email signatures, reflecting the brand's dynamic style

content.beforeParagraph: The party flyer and social media graphics were designed with the nightclub's sensual vibe and incorporating 70â€™s disco influences. The visuals feature a blend of fluorescent and smoky elements, evoking the ambiance of the club scene.
The holiday invitation layout is a Krampus theme with a dark and playful aesthetic. Bold, edgy elements and a moody color palette is a unique take on the spirit of the season.
The email signatures designed to align with Double Scorpio's branding, incorporating their color palette to build consistency, personality and professionalism to their digital communications.

works.title: Dai Hachi Branding
works.summary: Dai Hachi is a Japanese restaurant with a refined yet relaxed atmosphere, offering a mix of traditional cuisine in a modern setting. The branding needed to reflect this balance of elegance and simplicity

content.beforeParagraph: The goal was to create a visual identity that felt both sophisticated and approachable, mirroring the restaurant's ambiance. The logo design took inspiration from the natural, slender form of bamboo trees, translating these organic shapes into clean, modern typography. This choice gave the logo a minimalist yet distinctive look that aligned with the restaurant's philosophy.

An earthy color palette of greens, browns, and warm beige tones was used to further ground the brand in natural elements, evoking a calm and serene atmosphere. The branding was also enriched by the addition of circular abstract shapes, which emerged from experimenting with imagery from a local street art piece. These subtle, organic forms added a dynamic, artistic touch to the overall visual identity, tying together the traditional and modern elements of Dai Hachi's brand.

works.title: 420 Times Square Billboard
works.summary: This project entailed creating an animation for the Nasdaq billboard and other billboards in Times Square to celebrate 420

content.beforeParagraph: The animated billboard campaign, designed for the Nasdaq billboard in Times Square and additional locations, celebrated 420 by highlighting Indigenous Cannabis themes. The design, inspired by Indigenous imagery and natural elements, employed earthy tones and clean typography with simple graphics to deliver a respectful and engaging visual message. Commissioned by Honeysuckle and supported by Tilt Holdings, Little Beach Harvest, the Shinnecock Nation, Connor Green, and the Indigenous Cannabis Coalition, the project aimed to honor and promote Indigenous Cannabis culture.

works.title: Lucha Libre Packaging
works.summary: This branding project involved creating a logo and packaging design for a new churro snack brand, Lucha Libre. The goal was to capture the vibrant energy and tradition of Mexican lucha libre while maintaining a modern and youthful aesthetic

content.beforeParagraph: The logo design aimed to balance the excitement of lucha libre with the classic elements of the sport. A bold, dynamic typography was chosen to reflect the action and intensity of wrestling, while the vibrant color palette and luchador-inspired illustration added a playful and youthful touch.

The packaging design incorporated elements from traditional lucha libre posters, such as bold colors, dramatic typography, and iconic imagery. The layout was carefully crafted to create a visually striking and memorable package that would stand out.

works.title: Motion Design Collection
works.summary: A showcase of three distinct animations that blend vibrant pastel colors with sleek design elements. Each animation demonstrates a balance of dynamic movement and refined visual style, pushing the boundaries of modern digital aesthetics

content.beforeParagraph: This collection features three distinct animations that harmoniously blend vibrant pastel colors with refined design elements. The logo animation delivers a snappy and elegant visual, while the typographic motion brings playful sophistication to text. The final piece explores abstract shapes and colors in a dynamic, experimental style. Together, these animations showcase a seamless integration of dynamic movement and modern aesthetics.

works.title: UI Animation Experimentations
works.summary: A collection of UI animation explorations, showcasing diverse approaches to enhancing user interactions with dynamic visual effects

content.beforeParagraph: This series features a sleek and engaging sign-up page animation that elegantly guides users through the process. A playful button animation injects color and fun into every click, while explorations of UI elements like scroll bars, dimmers, selects, and switches experiment with color and movement to create a lively user experiences.

works.title: Poster Explorations
works.summary: Presenting a range of experimental posters, each exploring different design approaches and influences. The collection reflects a commitment to creative experimentation and a thoughtful engagement with historical design principles

content.beforeParagraph: Inspired by Armin Hofmann's work, this series reinterprets posters for 'Wilhelm Tell' through experimental photography. It employs a contemporary visual approach, exploring various uses of light and composition.
This series explores abstract design through various colors and shapes. Each poster delves into visual abstraction, focusing on how color and form interact to convey different emotions.
This series features typographic exploration and Swiss-style posters. The typographic pieces experiment with type as a design element, while the Swiss-style posters emphasize clarity and structure.
Inspired by Paul Rand's ABC logo, this final series experiments with abstract forms derived from his design. It reimagines Rand's principles through new, simplified interpretations.
